rComments: Emily is a fantastic teacher and a researcher at the top of her field, and she really wants her students to succeed. However, if you are not comfortable with math and physics, this class will be difficult for you. But don't despair! There are plenty of opportunities for help (go to office hours!) and Emily is all about second chances on exams.

Poor lecturer. Spends most of class reviewing what was taught last class (aka nothing) so its drawn out, tedious, and useless. Used a program for homework that was not compatible with many computers. Really irritating class - I ended up dropping because I couldn't tolerate the poor quality of the class.

If it wasn't for the T.A I wouldn't have passed the class. Definitely go to the T.A's office hours for help on the problem sets. Lectures didn't go so well either aka kinda boring. In the end the math really wasn't that hard I just wish I would have learned it before I did poorly on both midterms rather then the end of the quarter =/.

Many assignments rely too heavily on the derivations of equations.  She gives no partial credit on incorrect problems for tests and HW, which can be a pretty ruthless approach.  Her lectures often just consist of long drawn-out derivations.  Lots of time at her office hours is essential, but she offers only a few per week.  Definitely a tough one.
She held a fun class, but don't come in late or leave early. She'll remember you.
This class is SO boring, Brodsky is arrogant, and rude.  The labs were boring and used programs for experts in the field.  The field trip was pointless, way to long and COLD.

I thought she was a fun teacher because she was so excited about earthquakes and teaching everyone about them. She made examples fun in class with the use of over dramatic analogies. Some days were definitely better than others, but overall it was a really fun class

I'd suggest taking this class just because you never have to go to class. She posts the lectures online and even updates them for any changes she makes during class. She's funny and really loves what she's doing, it's just a very boring class. The field trip is also pretty awful, but if you show up you're good.

Prof Brodsky was an interesting teach, it was very easy to stay awake in the class.  Class participation will help you understand the materials better, though not terribly required.  Overall, a pretty good class

Easy class. Labs are pointless/boring but easy. 1 midterm which is really easy if you pay attention. She gets really annoying in that she spends a lot of time trying to get you to talk, which ends up wasting a lot of time. Doesn't treat you like college students, instead like elementary school age. Its not a bad class, she just gets annoying.
Fun and easy class, despite some difficulty on labs and rather vague answers to questions. I'd recommend Brodsky, just because of her upbeat and fun teaching style.
A good lecturer, but was not fair in grading.

Posts lecture notes twice, once before and once after w some changes.  Class uses some math skills, but not a lot.  Some of the concepts are difficult to get if you don't attend lectures, the notes don't help as much w/ the more specific ideas.  She does a recap of the previous lecture for the first part of the lecture.
Very passionate about the subject, pretty cool. Her voice is kinda funny but whatever. Easy way to fufill math GE. Tests are easy, easy work, you'll also learn a pretty good amount.

Emily was very knowledgable on the subject of earthquakes but her voice was inexcusable. If you can get past the "OMB" and the "hilarious" earth science jokes, its a pretty decent class...She fun to sit in lecture and watch.
